main event: A glowing object was observed going west then south over Macon, Georgia on May 28, 1965.
interesting points: The object was 12-14 inches in diameter.
The object was observed for 2-3 minutes, with the witness being fairly certain of the duration.
The object was observed at night, with few stars and no moonlight.
The object appeared solid and brighter than the brightest stars.
The witness was unable to estimate the speed or distance of the object.
